data.question: What is the formula of the MOF structure discussed?
What is the maximum r1 relaxivity value of nanoCAMOF-1 at 40 MHz?
Does the relaxivity of nanoCAMOF-1 increase with temperature?
What is the role of Cu(II) ions in the formation of CAMOF-1?
data.answer: Cu(II) ions are key actors in the formation of the MOF structure, chelated inside the cage formed by DOTP.

data.question: Is nanoCAMOF-1 stable in physiological saline solution?
What method was used to determine the maximum potential concentration of free Gd(III) ions?
What is the effect of nanoCAMOF-1 on the viability of HepG2 and MCF7 cells?
data.answer: Both cells showed good viability up to 200 μM nanoCAMOF-1.

data.question: Does the relaxivity of nanoCAMOF-1 remain constant over a wide pH range?
What is the significance of using DOTP in the synthesis of CAMOF-1?
data.answer: DOTP is used for its strong chelating capabilities and to limit free Gd(III) leaching.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of CAMOF-1?
Is the relaxivity of nanoCAMOF-1 affected by the presence of surfactants or thickeners?
What technique was used to confirm the microporosity of CAMOF-1?
Can nanoCAMOF-1 be used as a contrast agent (CA) for MRI?
data.answer: Yes, due to its high relaxivity and stability.

data.question: Is the formation of CAMOF-1 pH-dependent?
What is the role of Gd(III) ions in nanoCAMOF-1?
data.answer: Gd(III) ions contribute to the relaxivity and are coordinated by phosphonate groups from DOTP units.

data.question: Does nanoCAMOF-1 show significant toxicity due to leakage of free Gd(III) and Cu(II) ions?
What is the effect of pH on the crystal size of CAMOF-1?
data.answer: The crystal size is affected by pH, with macrocrystals formed at low pHs and nanocrystals at high pHs.

data.question: What is the primary advantage of using nanoMOFs as contrast agents?
data.answer: They can carry high Gd(III) concentrations per nanocrystal unit.

data.question: Are nanoCAMOF-1 nanowires uniform in size?
What is the impact of temperature on the formation of CAMOF-1?
data.answer: Temperature affects the crystal size, with high temperatures favoring macrocrystals.
